chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Jonathan Mclean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs + Fees + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be taken from prison monies or worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Must complete some type of 12 step program. Must take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed for mental health and/or substance abuse and with prior agent approval. No contact with known drug users or sellers unless in a treatment setting. No contact with J.M., D.L., R.T. or M.T. May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.

AODA assessment and follow through. Mental health and follow through. Maintain/Obtain full time employment. Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. DNA sample due: 02-16-2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:34 AM Defendant Tyler Jonathan Mclean in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Defendant Tyler Jonathan Mclean in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyler Jonathan Mclean appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Court imposes $20,000 cash bail w/conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact with R.T. or M.T. or their residence. 
Court schedules with parties.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
